required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Mouthwashes in Reducing Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) Viral Load in the Saliva
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Three Antimicrobial Mouthwashes in Reducing SARS-CoV-2 Viral Load in the Saliva of Patients Diagnosed With COVID-19: A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a single-blind, parallel-group, randomized pilot study designed to evaluate and compare the efficacy of 3 different mouthwashes containing 0.2% Chlorhexidine digluconate, 1.5% Hydroxide peroxide or Cetylpyridinium chloride in reducing Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) viral load in the saliva of COVID-19 positive patients at different time-points.
A convenient sample of up to 40 COVID-19 positive patients diagnosed via test and/or presenting COVID-19 clinical symptoms will be identified in the inpatients and/or outpatient clinics at the Newham University Hospital and at The Royal London Hospital, Barts Health National Health Service (NHS) Trust, United Kingdom (UK).
The study will consist of one visit. Unstimulated saliva samples will be collected from all COVID-19 positive patients before and at 30 minutes, 1, 2, and 3 hours after mouth rinsing (Group 1-3 ) or no rinsing (Group 4). Viral load analysis of saliva samples in the different time-points will be then assessed by Reverse Transcription quantitative PCR (RT- qPCR).

primary_outcome.measure: Viral load changes in the saliva within groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes, 1, 2 and 3 hours after mouth rinsing or no rinsing.
primary_outcome.description: Viral load changes in the saliva of COVID-19 positive patients assessed by RT-qPCR assays at 30 minutes, 1, 2 and 3 hours after mouth rinsing with a mouthwash containing 0.2 % Chlorhexidine digluconate, 1.5% Hydroxide peroxide or Cetylpyridinium chloride compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the viral load changes in the saliva between groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes, 1, 2 and 3 hours after mouth rinsing or no rinsing.
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in the viral load changes in the saliva of COVID-19 positive patients assessed by RT-qPCR assays, at the different study time-points, between groups 0.2 % Chlorhexidine digluconate, 1.5% Hydroxide peroxide, Cetylpyridinium chloride mouthwash and no rinsing (control).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 1 (test group; n= up to 10 patients) - 0.2 % Chlorhexidine digluconate
arm_group.description: Participants will be instructed to rinse their mouth with 10 ml of Corsodyl® Alcohol free mouthwash for 1 minute.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 2 (test group; n= up to 10 patients) - 1.5% Hydrogen peroxide
arm_group.description: Participants will be instructed to rinse their mouth with 10 ml of Colgate® Peroxyl mouthwash for 1 minute.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 3 (test group; n= up to 10 patients) - Cetylpyridinium chloride
arm_group.description: Participants will be instructed to rinse their mouth with 10 ml of Oral-B® Gum & Enamel Care mouthwashes for 1 minute.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 4 (control group; n= up to 10 patients) - No rinsing
arm_group.description: Patients will be instructed to not rinse their mouth with any solution, not even water.

intervention.description: Corsodyl® Alcohol-free is a clear to slightly opalescent oromucosal solution with an odour of peppermint that contains 0.2% w/v chlorhexidine digluconate which is an antimicrobial preparation for external use. It is effective against a wide range of Gram negative and Gram positive vegetative bacteria, yeasts, dermatophyte fungi and lipophilic viruses. It is active against a wide range of important oral pathogens and is therefore effective in the treatment of many common oral conditions.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group 1 (test group; n= up to 10 patients) - 0.2 % Chlorhexidine digluconate

intervention.description: Peroxyl mouthwash is a clear aqua-blue liquid oromucosal solution which 100ml of solution contains 1.5g of Hydrogen peroxide (as 30% Hydrogen Peroxide solution). It is an oral antiseptic cleanser for external use. The principal action is brought about by contact of hydrogen peroxide with peroxidases and catalases present in tissues and saliva, which causes the rapid release of oxygen. This provides mechanical cleansing which flushes out mouth debris and helps in the treatment of oral irritations. This mouthwash is used as a cleanser in the symptomatic relief of minor mouth and gum irritations.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group 2 (test group; n= up to 10 patients) - 1.5% Hydrogen peroxide

intervention.description: The Oral-B® Gum & Enamel Care mouthwash is an oromucosal solution containing Cetylpyridinium chloride (CPC) and used as an adjunct to oral hygiene.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group 3 (test group; n= up to 10 patients) - Cetylpyridinium chloride
Group 4 (control group; n= up to 10 patients) - No rinsing

patient_data.ipd_description: Aggregated/collective data regarding the efficacy of the different mouthwashes will be shared with the scientific community as a de-identified/coded information
